main event: A series of unidentified flying objects were reported over the Ryukyu Islands, Okinawa, observed by F-80 pilots on 27 June 1951.
interesting points: The sighting lasted for 23 minutes, and the objects were described as having vapor trails and appearing white in color., The altitude of the observed object reached 35,000 feet., Multiple reports of unidentified objects during late 1950 to early 1951 identified them as bright lights that could change colors and move at high speeds., Radar tracked one object with an altitude of 20,000 feet and a diameter of 40 feet, traveling at 600 knots., The report documents various conclusions regarding the nature of the sightings, including possibilities of it being a contrail or a balloon.
sighted object: unidentified flying objects with vapor trails
witness description: airmen stationed at a USAF base
